conclusion:
Date of Collection/Procedure/Outside Report: 5/30/1999
Date of Receipt: 5/31/1999
Date of Report: 6/6/1999

Clinical Diagnosis & History:
Site 1: Rule Out Melanoma, Lesion - New

Specimens Submitted:
1:  Right Dorsal Forearm, Biopsy- Shave

DIAGNOSIS:     
1.  Skin, Right Dorsal Forearm, Biopsy- Shave:
    - Seborrheic keratosis and increased density of junctional melanocytes (see note).

Note: Increased density of junctional melanocytes with variable atypia is
noted extending to tissue edges. While the findings are insufficient for the
diagnosis of a melanocytic neoplasm and background melanocytic hyperplasia
is considered; clinical correlation is recommended with consideration of
additional sampling if there is significant residual lesion or
repigmentation occurs.  
 
I ATTEST THAT THE ABOVE DIAGNOSIS IS BASED UPON MY PERSONAL EXAMINATION OF
THE SLIDES (AND/OR OTHER MATERIAL), AND THAT I HAVE REVIEWED AND APPROVED
THIS REPORT.

Jane Doe, M.D.
